title: Burmese Semolina Cake with Rum Raisins (Shwe Gye)

instructions.1: Combine rum, raisins, and brown sugar in a small saucepan over low heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, until raisins absorb rum, about 10 minutes.
instructions.2: Toast semolina in a dry saucepan over medium heat, stirring frequently, until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add water, coconut cream, sugar, oil, eggs, and salt; cook and stir until mixture thickens, 8 to 10 minutes. Reduce heat and stir in raisin mixture. Cook and stir until mixture pulls away from the sides of the pan, 5 minutes to 1 hour.
instructions.3: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9-inch baking dish.
instructions.4: Scrape semolina mixture into the prepared baking dish; smooth the top.
instructions.5: Bake in the preheated oven until top is golden brown, about 1 hour. Garnish with a drizzle of honey and poppy seeds.

questions.question: In Step 5, is the oven from Step 3 being used?
Is saucepan from Step 1 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is semolina from Step 2 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is oven from Step 3 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is brown sugar from Step 1 still available in Step 3?
Is brown sugar live after Step 3?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 2?
If we skip Step 1, is it still valid to use the saucepan in Step 2?
Can we scrape (Step 4) and bake (Step 5) at the same time?
